isAvoidLock

public boolean isAvoidLock()
Description copied from interface: Query
Indicates if the query will avoid to lock fetched data from access by other threads.

Specified by:
isAvoidLock in interface Query
Returns:
Returns an indicator showing if the query will avoid to lock fetched data from access by other threads.
See Also:
Query.setAvoidLock(boolean)

setAvoidLock

public void setAvoidLock(boolean avoidLock)
Description copied from interface: Query
Instructs the query to avoid putting any lock to the data it reads. Calling this method on a query with true instructs the query to avoid putting any locks to the data it reads. In case the query runs inside a transaction the fetched data should be locked, since update on these data would affect the current transaction. But in case the query does not run inside a transaction it could be acceptable to let data be modified by other threads, while it might be unacceptable to lock the data for a long time. In the latter case, the query should be instructed to avoid locks.
It is possible that the technology used for the implementation of the query can't support calling locking or avoiding locks. In such case, the method should throw a DataOperationNotSupportedException if this method is called with an argument true or false that can't be supported.

Specified by:
setAvoidLock in interface Query
Parameters:
avoidLock - Indicates if the query will avoid to lock fetched data.

init

public void init(Provider parent)
          throws InitializationException
Description copied from interface: Worker
Introduces the runtime context (environment) to the worker. The parent provides the runtime context. The runtime context can be anything that facilitates access to any back-end system (Databases, Files, Application Server etc).
Different implementations of Worker, will require from their parent provider resources of different types. Sub-interfaces of Provider can provide resources of any type. The implementations of worker must get the specific sub-type of Provider by their parent by calling the method parent.getProvider(subclass) where subclass is the sub-interface of Provider that is required.

Specified by:
init in interface Worker
Overrides:
init in class AbstractResourceConsumer
Parameters:
parent - The runtime provider
Throws:
InitializationException - When the parent fails to provide the resources required by the worker.
